body:
This is the answer: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1432961/how-do-i-make-httpurlconnection-use-a-proxy

`JdkRequest` is using `HttpURLConnection`, while `ApacheRequest` is using Apache HttpClient (which doesn't take into account that system properties)
We're using `ApacheRequest` because `HttpURLConnection` doesn't support `PATCH` method of HTTP
So, for read-only operations with Github you can use `JdkRequest` when behind proxy, but for write operations (which involve PATCH requests), you have to use `ApacheRequest`.
I understand the problem, but don't know how to solve it yet. Thanks for reporting it!
@yegor256 yes, will do. @carlosmiranda thank you for this ticket, your account was topped up for 15 mins, transaction ID: `DA2092645`
Thanks for the very helpful explanation, now I know what the difference is!

Been looking at the `ApacheRequest` code from ReXSL, and found this: https://github.com/yegor256/rexsl/blob/master/rexsl-test/src/main/java/com/rexsl/test/request/ApacheRequest.java#L90 ``` final CloseableHttpResponse response = HttpClients.createDefault().execute( this.httpRequest(home, method, headers, content) ); ``` I changed the call `HttpClients#createDefault()` to `HttpClients#createSystem()` and managed to get things working behind a proxy. (HttpClients Javadoc) ``` final CloseableHttpResponse response = HttpClients.createSystem().execute( this.httpRequest(home, method, headers, content) ); ``` Will there be any undesirable side effects if we obtain an `HttpClient` by using `HttpClients#createSystem()` instead of `HttpClients#createDefault()?` If you find this solution acceptable I can make the change for ReXSL and issue a pull request there. When the correct solution has been merged, perhaps we can close this ticket by updating JCabi-Github's dependencies to refer to the new version of ReXSL.

I verified that with the proposed solution above, our API can perform `PATCH` requests (as well as `GET`, `POST`, and `DELETE`) from behind a proxy. Let me know what you think.

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1917892/1875041/8a7aa4a0-78e4-11e3-93e4-eee809dca307.png)

Console log:


Looks great, I'll create an issue in ReXSL project and will assign it to you.

issue.title: ApacheRequest doesn't understand http.proxyHost system property

body: All right. I already made the pull request in ReXSL here: https://github.com/yegor256/rexsl/pull/747
I've released ReXSL 0.11.1 to Maven Central, with your bug fix
The budget here is **30 mins**, which is exactly how much time will be paid for, when the task is completed
@carlosmiranda this task is yours, please help (see our key [principles of work](http://www.tpc2.com/dev/principles)). If you have any technical questions, don't hesitate to ask right here
Created a pull request for this here, please have a look: https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi-github/pull/171
Hi @yegor256 , @dmarkov , the pull request for this task has been merged. Is there anything that's still needed before the task is closed and paid for?
